alert.note: Alert for Decatur (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 8:58AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Gadsden, north central Liberty, north central Leon and southern Decatur Counties through 1000 AM EDT... At 858 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Greensboro, or 7 miles west of Quincy, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Tallahassee, Quincy, Havana, Midway, Bainbridge, Greensboro, Chattahoochee, Gretna, Attapulgus, Freemont, Littman, Juniper, Douglas City, Darsey, Florence, Scotland, Rosedale, Jamieson, Recovery and Laingkat. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
